bug.short_desc: Java6: Add new interface functions in java.sql to test projects for JDK6 compliance

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 86113 1.6 compile errors for core.test and extension.oracle.test
As part of a future Java6 compliancy enhancement we will want to start with the following compile-time errors when using the latest 1.6.0_03-b05 JRE.
There are 133 errors as follows when compiling under 1.6.0 in the following test projects eclipselink.core.test eclipselink.extension.oracle.test
The java.sql package has some new 1.6 interface changes that affect our test code using the following classes Wrapper, Connection, DataSource, PreparedStatement, Statement and ResultSet
No target milestone set yet, but refer to related bug 214245 https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=214245 See http://wiki.eclipse.org/EclipseLink/Development/Java6
Some application servers like WLS10.3 require that the JDK is at level 1.6. This becomes an issue when deploying from Eclipse as the "Compiler compliance level" must be set to 1.6.
We have 178 items now but all are of the class - missing Emulated* function implementations

Created attachment 104042 eclipselink.core.patch (with 1.6 changes)
Compiles under 1.6.0_04
Created attachment 104051 eclipselink.core.patch (with 1.6 changes) - formatting, throws

I think we will need to hold off on this. I compile fine against 1.6, but I am getting 195 failures running test-core under 1.6 - might be my new view - I forgot to test it clean, I'll retest
Compiling/Running under 1.5 I am getting compilation errors for the new interfaces like [RowId] that are only in 1.6. We are going to have to wait to check in this fix until the build machine and all developers are running 1.6 (like we did with the 1.4->1.5 switch for generics)

Synopsis: Java6 compliance changes are not backwards compatible to 1.5 The move to JDK1.6 will need to be done for everyone at once.
Or those that require 1.6 can bypass test compilation by running the following target which completes in 26 sec. trunk>ant package-eclipselink-jar

Gordon, Good idea - I created stub classes for 1.5 of the 3 new 1.6 JDBC 4 interfaces. It would be good if we could conditionaly use these classes depending on the JRE used by eclipse or the JAVA_HOME when building via ant (if jre.version...).
1) PDE plugin does not export java* classes: I tried creating a new temporary plugin project java.sql_1.5.99 that will be a dependency of the core.test and extension.oracle.test projects. - ran into a problem - we cannot export packages prefixed with java Manifest-Version: 1.0 Bundle-ManifestVersion: 2 Bundle-Name: Resource Plug-in Bundle-SymbolicName: java.sql Bundle-Version: 1.5.99 Export-Package: java.sql
2) Simplest method would be to add the three new JDBC 4.0 API classes directly to the 2 test projects. - compiles under 1.5 and 1.6 - test.core under 1.5 is ok - test.core under 1.6 is generating between 185 and 233 failures mostly due to TNS listener refusals - testing browser is ?
3) Create a non-plugin java.sql.1.5.99 project and reference it from both test projects in foundation. - requires build changes both in SVN and on the build server - leave this for when we officially switch to java 6.
I am doing (2) - adding the classes to the 2 test projects - I have updated the diff. I haven't modifed the workbench scripts to override their "target-jvm" javac variable - since they have no 1.6 dependencies. We will probably need to modify the copyright header in these 3 java.sql stub interfaces.
What is the effect of not doing this work for the 1.0 release? Since we will be compiling our libraries using JDK5 is this required to run against 6?

The original driver for this work was the fact that WLS 10.3 requires 6 (bug# 236070) and I was unable to compile all projects in eclipse where I debugged the server - workaround was to not import test projects.
With the introduction of the 3 JDBC 4.0 interface stubs yesterday, this bug is no longer blocked by bug# 236185 (move to Java6), we decided on option 2, work is done and reviewed and will be checked in later today.
For 1.5 we compile ok (Ant and Eclipse) and test ok For 1.6 we compile ok (Ant and Eclipse) and test with 185 errors (to be fixed when we move to 1.6)
bottom line is all our projects compile in 1.5 or 1.6 with this fix and the introduction of a 1.5/1.6 compile target that defaults to 1.5
javac.version=1.5

Test results (checked in 20080610) On Oracle 11, Windows, Ant: UC 1: Compile on 1.5, run on 1.5 = OK UC 2: Compile on 1.5, run on 1.6 = OK (6 expected failures) UC 3: Compile on 1.6, run on 1.6 = 3x50 + 2x15 = 180 errors - Deferring to Bug# 236185 for future 1.0.1 fix.
Use the new ant variable to target the compiled source javac.version=1.5(default)|1.6
Completed: At revision: 17631

attachment.desc: 1.6 compile errors for core.test and extension.oracle.test
